result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garrett O Vanzile

defendant.name: Vanzile, Garrett O
defendant.address: 1 W Lincoln Street, Dodge Correctional, Waupun, WI 53963

records.addlTxt: Cancel paper hold, given a sig bond

10:47 AM Defendant Garrett O Vanzile appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional Institution.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lonnie D Story appeared by video for Garrett O Vanzile. Seifert - set for PH and believes it will be a waiver. Court questions if waiver has been uploaded. Story indicates he has not received back from Vanzile, has went over form with him and agrees to waive PH. Vanzile sent form back on Monday, agrees he is willing to waive his PH. Court goes over waiver on the record, finds he is freely voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH, court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has not been filed. Court questions if information mirrors would attorney like to proceed. Attorney Story agrees, with understanding that information will mirror complaint, proceeds to ARGN and enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas of NG and will have set for JT. Court orders state to have information filed within 24 hours. Court continues bond, has a signature bond but has refused to sign. Attorney Story asks court to reconsider bond amount, asks for $500 signature bond. Court explains it is a signature bond, defendant needs to sign it.
Consent from DE to allow attorney to appear remotely.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

09:14 AM Defendant Garrett O Vanzile in court with attorney Lonnie D Story.  Defendant Garrett O Vanzile in custody and appears from Dodge Correctional Institute.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Garrett O Vanzile appeared by video means with Attorney. Story has not had a chance to get in contact with the defendant. Vanzile does not have complaint. Court instructs State to provide complaint to defendant at Dodge Correctional - defendant confirms he will be there until mid-June. Court reads charges and penalties. Vanzile and Story understand charges and penalties, waives further reading, needs time to discuss the need for PH with his client. Court will set for PH. Story will waive time limits for that. Court considers time limits waived. State - bond - $5000.000 signature bond. Court - bond - $5000.00 signature bond, all parties can appear via Zoom, Zoom info to be on NOH, set up with Dodge, sets for PH on 5/26/22 at 10:45 AM.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
